msContents.summary:
I) Taʾāmra ʾIyasus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols. 3ra-128rb) I-1) ʾƎsaggǝd la-malakotǝka... “I worship Thy Godhead…” (fols. 3ra-5rb l.7) I-2) Introduction (fols. 5ra l.9-11va) - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book; on the creation and the fall of the angels (fols. 5ra l.9-8ra) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 8ra-11va) I-2) Taʾāmra ʾIyasus “Miracles of Jesus”: 63 miracles (fols. 11va-128rb)
Additio 1; colophon.

msItem.note: - Text I-1 is divided into strophes with a crude line, in modern pen.
- The scribe began the numbering from Text I-2 and continued up to miracle 36 on 58ra. Some numbers do not follow the sequence.

- The first part of Text I-2 is divided into two sections. The second section is introduced with the word mǝʿrāf “chapter” on 6rb. The second part of Text I-2 is introduced with the word mǝʿrāf “chapter”. It is divided into two sections. The second section, introduced with the word mǝʿrāf “chapter”, begins on 10rb.
- Most of the miracles are introduced with the words mǝʿrāf “chapter” and/or taʾammǝr “miracle”, täʾamrihu “his miracle” and nägär “speech”. A few miracles have no particular introducing word.

His name has been erased and replaced with the name Gabra Dǝngǝl, whose wife is Walatta Madḫǝn. Their names are written in moderate fuchsia, in a secondary hand, the same that wrote Additio 1 and added the names into the supplication formulas.

item.note: The note is written in a hand not much posterior to the main hand, the same which has added the names into the supplication formulas. It states that the book belongs to gwäytay blatta ʾƎmnotu who donated it to the church of Mädḥane ʿālam of Ḉäḥat. Also, the names of his family members are mentioned: his father Gabra Ṣādǝq, his mother Walatta Gabrǝʾel, his wife Walatta Madḫǝn and his children Walatta Mikāʾel, ʾAmata Māryām, Gabra Ḥawarya, Walatta Kidān and Walatta Śǝllāse. ʾƎmnotu is the same person as Gabra Dǝngǝl (s. the colophon).

list.item: - The scribe rubricated the text after he completed the writing in black ink. This is evident from the fact that often the rubricated nomina sacra and other names are shortened to fit the blank, e.g., ማርያም: is abbreviated to ማርያ: (13va) and ኢየሱስ: to ኢየሱ: (14rb, 29ra, 39ra, 43ra, 43vb). - Spaces for the rubrics have been left empty in some fols. (e.g., 45rb, 57va, 58ra). - Omitted letters, words or passages are inserted interlineally, in a small script: 60vb, 61ra, 64va, 70rb, 71ra, 72vb, 87ra, 128rb. - Pen trial: 19va. - Minor notes, writing exercises, doodles: 1v, 2rv, 11va, 125vb, 128v, 129v.

person.persName: According to Additio 1, gwäytay blatta ʾƎmnotu donated the Ms. to the church of Mädḥane ʿālam of Ḉäḥat. In the colophon, ʾƎmnotu is referred to with his baptismal name Gabra Dǝngǝl. This same name has been written over erasure or added interlineally in most of the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. Also, the names of his family members have been added. All names have been written in a secondary hand, the same as Additio 1.
The original owner was Gabra Ḥǝywat whose name has been erased from the colophon and from most of the supplication formulas but retained on some fols., e.g., 41rb, 43ra, 46rb, 47rb, 50rb, 78rb.
